text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 25.25.9, Revenue Protection, Prisoner Lead Procedures.
IRM 25.25.9.1.2, Program Management and Review - Updated naming convention for RIVO- IPU 22U0920 issued 09-08-2022.
IRM 25.25.9.1.5, Acronyms - Updated the IRM Reference- IPU 22U0920 issued 09-08-2022.

IRM 25.25.9.2, Prisoner Lead Processing Overview - Added EIP and deﬁned acronym for RRC. Added RRC and guidance. Updated acknowledgement Emails and provided links to feedback scripts- IPU 22U0920 issued 09-08-2022.
IRM 25.25.9.2.1, Prisoner Mailbox Procedures - Add new subsection, providing mailbox guidance- IPU 22U0920 issued 09-08-2022.

IRM 25.25.9.3, Prisoner Lead Clerical Sort and Routing of Initial Receipts - Updated routing procedures to include ACTC payments. Updated routing procedures for ACTC payments. Added EIP and updated routing guide link.- IPU 21U1299 issued 11-30-2021, IPU 21U1324 issued 12-08-2021, IPU 22U0920 issued 09-08-2022.
IRM 25.25.9.4, General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT) Returns - Updated guidance- IPU 22U0920 issued 09-08-2022.
IRM 25.25.9.5, Prisoner Lead Processing Returns (Kansas City) - Updated guidance. Added an IF and Then chart with scenarios and actions- IPU 22U0920 issued 09-08-2022.
IRM 25.25.9.6, Prisoner Lead Identity Theft Form Receipts - Deleted IRM section- IPU 22U0920 issued 09-08-2022.
IRM 25.25.9.6, Renumbered from IRM 25.25.9.8, Prison Leads Involving Refund Checks - Updated procedures for processing refund checks- IPU 22U0920 issued 09-08-2022.
IRM 25.25.9.7, Refund Inquiries - Deleted IRM section- IPU 22U0920 issued 09-08-2022.
IRM 25.25.9.8.1.2, Inquiry With Federal Tax Refund check - Deleted IRM section- IPU 22U0920
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
IRM 25.25.9 effective 10-13-2021 is superseded. This includes IPU 21U1299, IPU 21U1324, IPU 22U0920, dated 11-30-2021 through 09-08-2022.

Table of Contents
Program Scope and Objectives
Revenue Protection Prisoner Lead Procedures 25.25.9 page
) Scope and (

) Purpose and Program Goals: This IRM section provides guidance for Return Integrity Veriﬁcation Operations (RIVO) employees when in receipt of prisoner correspondence/returns/checks received through the Blue Bag Program from participating institutions. (
) Audience: The audience intended in this IRM is RIVO employees. (
) Policy Owner: The Return Integrity Veriﬁcation Program Management (RIVPM) is the policy owner of this program. (
) Program Owner: RIVPM is the program office responsible for oversight over this program. (
) Primary Stakeholders: The primary stakeholders are RIVO, and organizations that collaborate with RIVO, such as: Submission Processing, Account Manage- ment, and Field Assistance. (
) Program Goals: Program goals for the program are in the Operation Guide- lines as well as IRM
, Return Integrity & Veriﬁcation Operation Managers Guide .
) Background (

) Return Integrity Veriﬁcation Program Management (RIVPM) strengthens the integrity of the tax system by: • Protecting the public interest by improving IRS’s ability to detect and prevent improper refunds • Serving the public interest by taking actions fairly and appropriately identify, evaluate and prevent the issuance of improper refunds • Helping taxpayers understand the refundable tax credits for which are eligible • Recovering Improper Payments
) Management Review (
) The program has reports such as: the RIVO Monthly Performance Comparison Report, to track the inventory, including receipts and closures. Additional guidance is found in IRM
, Return Integrity & Veriﬁcation Operation Managers Guide . (

) The Embedded Quality review program is in place to review all processes ensure accuracy and effectiveness of the program. Goals, measures, and operating guidelines are listed in the yearly Operation Guidelines and in IRM

, Embedded Quality (EQ) Program for Accounts Management, Campus Compliance, Field Assistance, Tax Exempt/Government Entities, Return Integrity and Compliance Services (RICS), and Electronic Products and Services Support .
) Refer to the following: • IRM
, Servicewide Policies and Authorities, Servicewide Delega- tions of Authority • IRM
, Organization and Staffing, Wage and Investment. • Various Internal Revenue Codes (IRC) including but not limited to: • IRC
(a), Authority to make credits or refunds • IRC
, Amounts treated as overpayments • IRC
, Abatements of tax • IRC
, Restrictions on assessments and math error authority Revenue Protection Prisoner Lead Procedures

)(B)(iv) for more information on General Agreement of Tariffs and Trade (GATT) rule of disqualifying a prisoner’s income earned during incarceration for Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC). (
) Return Integrity Veriﬁcation Program Management (RIVPM) has responsibility for information in this IRM. Information is published in the IRM on a yearly basis. (
) The Director of RIVPM is responsible for the policy related to this IRM. (
) The Chief of the RIVPM Policy & Analysis is responsible for ensuring this is timely submitted to publishing each year. (
) More information can be found in IRM
, Return Integrity and Compli- ance Services (RICS) . (
) For a list of Acronyms used throughout Return Integrity Veriﬁcation Operations (RIVO), see IRM
, Acronyms . Resources (

) The related resources listed below may be utilized for account research and issue resolution. These related resources may be accessed through the IRS Intranet-Servicewide Electronic Research Program (SERP) site. • IRM
, Revenue Protection • IRM
, Identity Protection and Victim Assistance • IRM
, Customer Account Services • IRM
, Information Technology • IRM
, Submission Processing • IRM
, Examining Process (
) IDRS restricted access accounts are accounts where a user must request special permissions to access the account through IDRS. Follow IRM
, Authorized IDRS Access . (
) The IRS adopted the Taxpayer Bill of Rights (TBOR) in June
Employees are responsible for being familiar with and acting in accordance with taxpayer rights. See IRC
), Execution of Duties in Accord with Taxpayer Rights. The Taxpayer Bill of Rights (TBOR) lists rights that already existed the tax code, putting them in simple language and grouping them into
damental rights. Employees are responsible for being familiar with and acting in accord with taxpayer rights. See IRC
), Execution of Duties in Accord with Taxpayer Rights. For additional information about the TBOR, The IRS outlines the Taxpayer Bill of Rights . Lead Overview (

) Non-RIVO functions will route all items as appropriate based on existing guidance and procedures. Non-RIVO functions should not route to the below, unless speciﬁcally instructed to by another IRM. (

) Items received in RIVO through the Blue Bag Program from participating tutions will be date stamped by the receiving office, sorted into the following categories and routed as appropriate: • Brookhaven RIVO only - Tax returns - any Form
, U.S. Individual Income Tax Return , series (including copies and unsigned returns),

received from participating correctional institutions, - route returns to MS 6575 Prisoner Return KCSC, 333 Pershing Rd., Kansas City, MO 64108.
Exception: Route Tax returns claiming Economic Impact Payments (EIP)/Recovery Rebate Credits (RRC) only to Austin . These returns do not meet Blue Bag criteria.
Brookhaven RIVO Only - Amended tax returns - Any Form
X, Amended U.S. Individual Income Tax Return , does not meet Blue Bag criteria. Route all amended returns to your local Imaging Control Team (ICT). Check

Pershing Rd., Kansas City, MO
All Non-Treasury checks and all other Treasury checks (excluding IRS refund check) - Route to Submission Processing for posting to taxpay- er’s account.
Reminder: Correspondence and loose forms are not worked in the Blue Bag Program.

E-mails received in RIVO through the Blue Bag Program (BBP) from participating institutions will receive one of the following responses from the designated point of contact (POC): BBP Lead Acknowledgement E-mail which informs the sender that the BBP received their email inquiry and/or a BBP General Acknowledgement Referral E-mail which informs the sender that the BBP does not handle that inquiry and provides them with the Customer Service telephone number and IRS website. The designated POC will create and populate all required lead folders and add the case record to the Lead Management - Blue Bag (LMBB) system, IRM
, Prisoner Lead Mailbox Procedures.

) Employees assigned to the mailbox process will review E-mails received and identify leads and/or inquiries by ﬂag. Follow local procedures for ﬂag determi- nations. Note: If the inquiry is from a new correctional facility, send the Blue Bag Fact Sheet and the Blue Bag Lead spreadsheet using the applicable feedback script.
) Employees assigned to the mailbox process will review E-mails received and identify leads and/or inquiries by ﬂag. Follow local procedures for ﬂag determi- nations.
Note: If the inquiry is from a new correctional facility, send the Blue Bag Fact Sheet and the Blue Bag Lead spreadsheet using the applicable feedback
Note: If the inquiry requires elevation to Headquarters, forward to the RIVO Planning & Analysis BBP POC.
) All leads and/or inquiries will receive an acknowledgement E-mail, see the RIVO Blue Bag SERP Portal , sent to the Correctional Facility Official within
days upon receipt.
Note: If the E-mail is not a lead or inquiry pertaining to the BBP but is for another IRS business unit, issue the BBP General Acknowledgement Referral E-mail .
Caution: DO NOT disclose internal research guidance in E-mail referrals. Also remove all internal information from correspondence received before sending the feedback script. (
) Create a lead folder and save to the designated site folder. (
) The following items must be saved to the lead folder: • Original E-mail • Acknowledgement E-Mail • All spreadsheets and/or attachments received with the E-mail (e.g., Blue Bag Lead spreadsheet) •
Note: Do not edit or modify any original documents received.
) Import all lead information into the LMBB. (
) The Unit Control Clerk (UC) will date stamp all items received into the Operation, including undeliverable and non-delivered mail. (
) The UC will review all items received for updated Incarceration/Release date information and capture such data for the Operation on the provided FTBOL- FY
XX Master File listing. (
) Returns received should be re-routed as shown below. • Brookhaven RIVO only -Tax returns - any Form

, Routing Guide/Local Maildex. .

Exception: Do not route EIP/RRC only refund checks to Kansas City, instead route them to Submission Processing for posting. EIP checks can usually be identiﬁed in the memo section of the check.

North Circle, Omaha, NE

) Not all prisoners/inmates had indicators placed on their account to stop the Advance Child Tax Credit (ACTC) payments. If you receive an inquiry from Correctional Institutions regarding these payments, please do the following: • Review the incarceration dates provided by the Correctional Institution, see IRM
, Prisoner Leads. • Determine if the inmate was or will be incarcerated for more than half the year in
• If the inmate was or will be incarcerated for more than half the year
, advise the Correctional Institution to return the check to: Internal Revenue Service, MS
Prisoner Check KCSC,
W. Pershing Rd., Kansas City, MO
• If the inmate has not or will not be incarcerated for more than half the year in
, advise the Correctional Institution that the check does need to be returned to the IRS. (

) Checks will be processed as follows: a. All Non-Treasury checks and all other Treasury checks (excluding IRS refund check) - Route to Submission Processing for posting to taxpayer’s account. b. If a live personal check is received take the following actions: • Complete Form
, Record of Discovered Remittance. • Attach a photocopy of the personal check and any pertinent information to the Form

• Notate any important information on the check such as the taxpayer’s Social Security number (SSN), tax period, and form number for correct processing. • Route the check to Campus Support to be processed, see IRM
, Remittance Discovered at a Campus Support Site. on (GATT) (
) Legislation in
implementing part of the General Agreement on Tariffs Trade (GATT) (IRC §

)(B)(iv)), excluded amounts received for services provided by an inmate at a penal institution from the deﬁnition of earned income for the earned income tax credit (EITC) and credits which utilize the EITC deﬁnition of earned income. GATT returns are identiﬁed when a ﬁler claims EITC (or a refundable credit that uses the EITC deﬁnition of earned income) based on valid wages and withholding earned while an inmate. (

) Generally, most prisoners who ﬁle returns containing wages earned while in- carcerated, regardless of ﬁling status, are not entitled to the following refundable credits: • Earned Income Tax Credit (EITC) • Additional Child Tax Credit (ACTC) • Making Work Pay Credit (MWPC) (

)(B)(iv)), excluded amounts received for services provided by an inmate at a penal institution from the deﬁnition of earned income for the earned income tax credit (EITC) and credits which utilize the EITC deﬁnition of earned income. If you receive a prisoner checks meeting the above criteria, please forward to Kansas City, Return Integrity Veriﬁcation Operations (RIVO).
MS 6575 Prisoner Check KCSC, 333 Pershing Rd., Kansas City, MO
Note: Income documents (IDOCs) on all returns should be captured in the LMBB.
When researching/reviewing paper returns to be sent to processing, follow the If/And/Then chart below for the appropriate action.

If ... And ... Then ... Identity Theft - Examples of some IDT characteristics can be found in IRM 25.25.2.12, Identity Theft Scheme Criteria • Stamp “RIVO REV” • Edit the return with a special project code (SPC) ‘M’ • Add IDOCS to the LMBB • Send the return for processing

If ... And ... Then ... General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT) issues, see IRM 25.25.9.4, General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT) Returns. CC FTBOL does not indicate full year prisoner (FYP) but the incarcerated dates provided with the BBP referral differ from IRS records and indicate a FYP. Note: Only refer to GATT if incomeveriﬁes The return claimed ACTC or EITC and the income claimed on the return veriﬁes within RIVO thresh- olds, see IRM 25.25.2-4, Tolerance Chart • Stamp “RIVO REV” • Edit the return with a CCC ‘1’ • Establish a monitor control base on IDRS using the activity, status, and category - “AQCMONI-TOR,M,MICS” • Add IDOCS to the LMBB • Send the return for processing • After the return posts to EFDS, load all IDOCs and input the return note “PossibleGATT” • Input a CC TXMODAhistoryitem“GATTTOAQC”onIDRSandclosetheRIVOcontrolbase • If the return indicates a date of incarceration (DOI)/date of release (DOR) that differs from CC FTBOL, update the FTBOL Master- ﬁle listing 25.25 Revenue Protection

If ... And ... Then ... Frivolous Claims, see the Frivolous Return Program (FRP) screening IRM 25.25.2.19, Frivolous Returns • Stamp “RIVO REV” • Edit the return with a CCC ‘3’ • Establish a monitor control base on IDRS using the activity, status, and control category - “FRPMONI-TOR,M,MISC” • Add IDOCS to the LMBB • Send the return to processing • After the return posts to EFDS, load all IDOCs and add the note “PRS RETURN - FRP CRITERIA”,anddispositionthereturninEFDStoprocessstatus(PS)70/”RIVOHolding-FRPSelected” • Close the monitor control base Protection Prisoner Lead Procedures 25.25.9 page

If ... And ... Then ... Entity Fabricated IDOCs Note: Send to the lead/SME for review, if agreed take the appropri- ate actions. • Stamp “RIVO REV” • Edit the return with a CCC ‘1’ • Establish a monitor control base on IDRS using the activity, status, and category - “EFMONI-TOR,M,MISC” • Add all IDOCs to the LMBB • Send the return for processing • After the return posts to EFDS load all IDOCs • If the IDOC Employer Iden- tiﬁcationNumber (EIN) is on mode of contact (MOC) 231/‘Suspicious’dispositionthereturntoPS33/Verify.IftheEINisnotdis-positionedtoMOC‘Suspi-cious’dispositionthereturntoPS31/ Ace Collections and input the note “Potential FabricatedEntity” • Forward to the BBP lead/SME to send the referral to the Entity Fabrica- tion team at • Close the monitor control base 25.25 Revenue Protection Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No. 61694A (11-21-2022)
Revenue Protection Prisoner Lead Procedures 25.25.9

) Leads are received in Kansas City from prisons regarding tax refund checks issued by the Department of Treasury. The assigned team is to research the taxpayer’s account to determine if the refund check is valid. A Blue Bag Ac- knowledgement e-mail (see the RIVO BB SERP Portal ) will be sent to the Cor- rectional Facility Official within
days upon receipt of the prison lead inquiry.
Note: RIVO teams receiving a prison lead regarding prisoner refund checks should
should follow existing procedures. (
) All prisoner checks received in RIVO will be sent to Kansas City. Mailing Address is, Internal Revenue Service, MS
Prisoner Check KCSC,
W Pershing Rd., Kansas City, MO

) The BBP UC will log receipt of all prisoner checks in LMBB. Note: Route other payment types (money orders or checks payable to the Depart- ment of Treasury, etc.) to the appropriate campus Submissions Processing (SP) Payment Processing Unit (PPU) function. (

) Kansas City (Only) Tax Examiners (TEs), when an inquiry (copy of check or telephonic/fax/email/written inquiry) regarding the validity of a check in a cor- rectional facility’s possession or a returned prisoner tax refund check from a correctional facility is received, the TE will ensure the following actions are taken on all accounts meeting RIVO interest: a. Research the associated return for RIVO interest as described below in the If/And/Then chart. Note: If the account contains a TC
AC

with MISC ﬁeld “TPP Recovery,” do not research further, instruct the correctional facility to return the check. b. Review CC FTBOLP on IDRS against the facilities DOI/DOR provided the referral. If the DOI/DOR differ on the referral from the IRS records update the FTBOL-FY

XX Master File listing. c. If the physical tax refund check has not been returned and requesting funds, advise the correctional facility to return the tax refund check by issuing the Memorandum for Return of Erroneously Issued Income Tax Refund Check . Be cautious not to disclose details regarding the taxpay- er’s account. d. Save a copy of the e-mail and any documentation in the lead folder. e. Input a TC
AC
if one is not already present on IDRS.
should follow existing procedures.

Kansas City (Only) Tax Examiners (TEs), when an inquiry (copy of check or telephonic/fax/email/written inquiry) regarding the validity of a check in a cor- rectional facility’s possession or a returned prisoner tax refund check from a correctional facility is received, the TE will ensure the following actions are taken on all accounts meeting RIVO interest:
to return the check. Review CC FTBOLP on IDRS against the facilities DOI/DOR provided on the referral. If the DOI/DOR differ on the referral from the IRS records update the FTBOL-FY

XX Master File listing. If the physical tax refund check has not been returned and requesting funds, advise the correctional facility to return the tax refund check by issuing the Memorandum for Return of Erroneously Issued Income Tax Refund Check . Be cautious not to disclose details regarding the taxpay- er’s account. Save a copy of the e-mail and any documentation in the lead folder. Input a TC

if one is not already present on IDRS.

C#,PRSLEAD,A,MISC1481622222,NNNNNNNN (N = the received date of the inquiry or the re- fund check) g. Input a history item: H,DONOTRFUND h. Document the case and actions on the Account Management Services (AMS), see IRM 21.2.2.4.5, Account Management Services. The docu- mentation should be input for the tax year of the inquiry or the refund check. i. Update LMBB with case details. . If ... And ... Then ... Identity Theft - Examples of some IDT scheme characteris- tics can be found in IRM 25.25.2.12, Identity Theft Scheme Criteria • Request funds • Update the “PRSLEAD” control base to a monitor control base on IDRS using the activity, status, and category code - “REQFUNDS,M,MISC”assignedtoIDRS#1481600002 • Monitor the weekly Automated Age Listing (AAL) for the posted funds • When funds post - Current year (CY) processed returns - disposition the return in EFDS to Ace Ad- justments and input the return note “RIVO RSV IDT” • Prior year (PY) returns already in STARS, update the STARS return informa- tion to the appropriate category per IRM 25.25.4.3, Identity Theft Return Categories • PY returns not already in STARS, place on the Mass Push spreadsheet inputting a ‘7’ in column J, “STARS Category” • Update the control base “841POSTED” and assign to the originating TE
Revenue Protection Prisoner Lead Procedures

If ... And ... Then ... Income and withholding are questionable, see IRM 25.25.2.2, Data Mining Screening and IRM 25.25.2.14, Prisoner Returns Wages/Withholding are not supported by CC IRPTR data ( see IRM 25.25.2.3, Command Code (CC) IRPTR Return Veriﬁ- cation During Screening Process) or appropriate lookback • Request funds • Update the “PRSLEAD” control base to a monitor control base on IDRS using the activity, status, and category code - “REQFUNDS,M,MISC”assignedtoIDRS#1481600002 • Monitor the weekly AAL for the posted funds • When the funds post - CY processed returns - dispo- sition the return in EFDS to PS 33/Veriﬁcation • PY returns - place on the Mass Push spreadsheet to add the return to STARS and add to the appropriate Manual Referral spread- sheet for treatment, see IRM 25.25.13.5, Manual Referrals • Update the control base “841POSTED” and assign to the originating TE Revenue Protection Prisoner Lead Procedures 25.25.9 page 13

If ... And ... Then ... General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT) issues, see IRM 25.25.9.4, General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT) Returns. If the incarcera- tion dates provided with the BBP referral differ from IRS records and indicate FYP Note: Only refer to GATT if income veriﬁes • Request funds • Update the “PRSLEAD” control base to a monitor control base on IDRS using the activity, status, and category code - “REQFUNDS,M,MISC”assignedtoIDRS#1481600002 • Monitor the weekly AAL for the posted funds • When the funds post - CY processed returns - input a return note “POSSIBLE GATT” • PY returns - place on the Mash Push spreadsheet inputting a ‘1’ in column J, “STARS Category”, to add the return to STARS • After the return is in STARS update the STARS Return Status Disposition to ‘TT’ and the Referral Category to ‘8’ • Place on the Automated Questionable Credits (AQC) Manual Referral spreadsheet for treatment, see IRM 25.25.13.5, Manual Referrals • Update the control base “841POSTED” and assign to the originating TE page 14 25.25 Revenue Protection
Revenue Protection Prisoner Lead Procedures

If the tax refund has not been returned, monitor the lead for 45 days. If 45 days have passed and no tax refund check is received, issue the BBP 45 Day Follow Up E-mail letter and a copy of the check request memorandum. If after
